headline: Activist Elliott Sues Phillips 66 and Board in Another Push for Seat Changes
summary: Activist investor Elliott Investment Management sued Phillips 66 and its board of directors to require four board seats be up for election at the oil refiner’s next annual shareholder meeting.

raw.headline: Activist Elliott Sues Phillips 66 and Board in Another Push for Seat Changes
raw.summary: Activist investor Elliott Investment Management sued Phillips 66 and its board of directors to require four board seats be up for election at the oil refiner’s next annual shareholder meeting.

headline: Activist Elliott sues Phillips 66 to protect shareholder rights
summary: The complaint, filed in the Delaware Chancery Court, seeks to have four directors stand for election at the company's annual meeting this year.  The lawsuit comes less than four weeks after Elliott, which owns a $2.5 billion stake in Phillips 66, nominated seven directors to the company's board.

raw.headline: Activist Elliott sues Phillips 66 to protect shareholder rights
raw.summary: The complaint, filed in the Delaware Chancery Court, seeks to have four directors stand for election at the company's annual meeting this year.  The lawsuit comes less than four weeks after Elliott, which owns a $2.5 billion stake in Phillips 66, nominated seven directors to the company's board.

headline: Elliott Takes Legal Action to Protect the Rights of Phillips 66 Stockholders
summary: Elliott Investment Management L.P. ("Elliott"), which manages funds that together have an investment of more than $2.5 billion in Phillips 66 (NYSE: PSX) (the "Company" or "Phillips"), today filed a lawsuit in the Court of Chancery of the State of Delaware (the "Court") against the Company and its Board of Directors (the "Board").

raw.headline: Elliott Takes Legal Action to Protect the Rights of Phillips 66 Stockholders

("Elliott"), which manages funds that together have an investment of more than $2.5 billion in Phillips 66 (NYSE: PSX) (the "Company" or "Phillips"), today filed a lawsuit in the Court of Chancery of the State of Delaware (the "Court") against the Company and its Board of Directors (the "Board").

headline: Elliott Sues Phillips 66 to Put Board Nominees Up for Vote
summary: Elliott Investment Management has asked a court to order Phillips 66 to require four board seats to stand for election at its annual shareholder meeting.

raw.headline: Elliott Sues Phillips 66 to Put Board Nominees Up for Vote
